description: Nikola Petrak unlocks his briefcase, drafting and authorizing a citywide broadcast message declaring, 'Truth is consensus. Consensus is broken.' He triggers the automated alert cascade, ensuring the message will be seen and heard across all of Stenograd.

A synchronized broadcast interrupts every device in the city. The stark message, 'Truth is consensus. Consensus is broken,' sparks immediate confusion, debate, and speculation as no Council member claims responsibility.

Neighborhood forums ignite in response to the broadcast. Residents debate new forms of governance as alliances fracture and old grievances come to the surface, with some districts immediately forming local assemblies.
The Council tries to regain control by calling a citywide assembly, but most districts refuse to participate, focusing instead on self-made rules as the BCI loses relevance in everyday life.

Districts publish their new autonomous charters. Scoring is abolished in some areas, while others develop community-based trust systems. Evidence begins to circulate that Marek Halden set this transformation in motion, deepening the sense of a new beginning.
